Identity.History: The Phoenicians were a people that lived in todayâ€™s Lebanon. They were a group of city-states and known for their naval forces, colonies (they had colonies in Africa, Italy Spain and maybe Great Britain) and trading abilities(they traded in purple, cedar wood and papyrus and even reached Guinea). They were first subjugated by the Egyptians, later by the Assyrians, Babylonians and Persians. When Alexander the Great reached phoenicia, he had to besiege Tyre for 7 months.
